perturbation.original_text: (e) Compliance with all Laws: Licensee shall comply with all laws, rules, treaties, and regulations governing the distribution of the Wireless Products throughout the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text: (b) Product Support: Licensee shall provide all customer product support, including technical support, for the Wireless Products in the same manner as it provides such support for any other product that it distributes and/or publishes, and in any case in accordance with wireless industry standards. Licensee will display (and ensure that the CSP displays) a toll free telephone number (or an email address, in Licensee’s discretion, on a country by country basis) on its website so that customers may contact Licensee and/or the CSP regarding the Wireless Products (“Customer Request”). Licensee and/or the CSP will use all commercially reasonable efforts to respond to each such Customer Request within 24 hours after receipt of such request. Licensee shall exercise commercially reasonable efforts to resolve each such Customer Request. Licensee also shall respond to all inquiries from VGSL relating to the Wireless Products delivered to VGSL.(e) Compliance with all Laws: Licensee shall comply with all laws, rules, treaties, and regulations governing the distribution of the Wireless Products throughout the Territory.
perturbation.explanation: The compliance clause is now placed within the 'Product Support' section, making it less prominent and easily overlooked.  Compliance with laws is a general obligation, and this placement obscures its importance by embedding it within a section about customer support.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring clear and conspicuous disclosure of obligations.

perturbation.original_text: (f) Internet Data: Licensee shall comply with COPPA regulations as well as with Fox’s Internet Privacy Policy with respect to the collection of any consumer information via the Internet. The policy is attached hereto as Exhibit P and incorporated herein by this reference.
perturbation.changed_text: (a) Marketing and Promotion: Licensee shall be responsible for all marketing, advertising and promotional efforts with respect to the Wireless Products throughout the Territory during the Term. Licensee shall (A) participate in face to face meetings and conference calls regarding marketing from time to time, the frequency, location and subject matter of which shall be mutually agreed; (B) submit a separate marketing plan for the Wireless Products for each Property for which Fox has approved a Treatment (as defined in Paragraph 9(a)(ii)) within thirty (30) days of Fox’s approval of such Treatment, subject to Fox’s providing sufficient information regarding its release plans for the applicable Property (each, a “Marketing Plan”); (C) commit funds to the marketing of the Wireless Products as is commensurate with Licensee’s marketing efforts of other similar wireless products that Licensee publishes; (D) perform business to business and trade marketing efforts (e.g., to the CSPs) commensurate with industry standards; and (E) appoint a marketing point of contact which shall be responsible for coordinating communications and facilitating relationships between Fox and Licensee and for overseeing the performance of Licensee’s obligations hereunder.(f) Internet Data: Licensee shall comply with COPPA regulations as well as with Fox’s Internet Privacy Policy with respect to the collection of any consumer information via the Internet. The policy is attached hereto as Exhibit P and incorporated herein by this reference.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the COPPA compliance statement into the 'Marketing and Promotion' section is misleading. COPPA is about children's privacy, not marketing. This placement dilutes the significance and makes it harder to find when specifically looking for privacy obligations.

perturbation.original_text: (e) Governing Law; Jurisdiction; Service of Process: This Agreement shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California applicable to agreements executed and to be wholly performed therein. The parties hereto agree that any suit, action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be instituted and prosecuted in the United States District Court for the Central District of California or in any court of competent jurisdiction of the State of California. The parties hereto irrevocably submit to the jurisdiction of said courts and waive any rights to object to or challenge the appropriateness of said forums. Service of process shall be in accordance with the laws of the State of California.
perturbation.changed_text: (b) Waiver, Modification: The terms of this Agreement may not be waived or modified except by an agreement in writing executed by the parties hereto. The waiver by either party of any breach of this Agreement by the other party must be in writing and shall not be deemed to be a waiver of any prior or succeeding breach. (e) Governing Law; Jurisdiction; Service of Process: This Agreement shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California applicable to agreements executed and to be wholly performed therein. The parties hereto agree that any suit, action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be instituted and prosecuted in the United States District Court for the Central District of California or in any court of competent jurisdiction of the State of California. The parties hereto irrevocably submit to the jurisdiction of said courts and waive any rights to object to or challenge the appropriateness of said forums. Service of process shall be in accordance with the laws of the State of California.
perturbation.explanation: The choice of law clause has been mixed in with the waiver/modification clause. Some parties might not be aware that the choice of law clause exists as they will look for it in a completely different portion of the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring clear and conspicuous disclosure of governing law.
